greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: An indicator sequence for the Jacobsthal numbers.
comment: a(n) is the number of solutions to the Diophantine equation 2*x^2 - (9*n+1)*x + 9*n^2 = 1 where valid solutions are restricted to powers of 4. - _Hieronymus Fischer_, May 17 2007
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..87381
formula: a(n) = 1 + floor(log_2(3n+1)) - ceiling(log_2(3n-1)) = floor(log_2(3n+1)) - floor(log_2(3n-2)) for n >= 1. Also true: a(n) = 1 + A130249(n) - A130250(n) = A130253(n) - A130250(n) = A130250(n+1) - A130250(n) for n >= 0. - _Hieronymus Fischer_, May 17 2007
xref: For partial sums see A130253. Cf. A130249, A130250, A147612.
results.author: _Paul Barry_, Apr 01 2005
